(Received 26th, 11 a.m.) Secret. Afghanistan. My telegram of the 15th March. British Agent, who isstill at Jalalabad, reports 17th March that alarm has been caused in Kabul andJalalabad by news of revolt of the Governor and Commander-in-Chief, Herat; thatKabul troops (? at) Jalalabad are showing signs of mutiny and that regiments of native cavalry are again threatening. Had Herat rumour been founded upon fact,we should almost certainly have heard of it through Meshed, and it is probably basedon fact that Governor and Commander-in-Chief both belong to (? Musahib) family,now under arrest. According to Meshed reports, news of Habibulla's death wasreceived quietly in Herat about 5th March. News of Amanulla's succession, whichwe asked Meshed to send to Herat, should have reached Herat (? only) a few days ago.
